ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Respondent
Notes: NA=Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Respondent details
1) How much do you believe that this treatment will help your child to better control his or her behavior?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Between 2 and 3; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Between 3 and 5; 5 = A lot

ElementDescription: 2) How much do you believe the treatment will help you in being a parent?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Between 2 and 3; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Between 3 and 5; 5 = A lot

ElementDescription: 3) How much time do you think you will have to spend outside the sessions on tasks or activities related to treatment?
Notes: 1 = No time; 2 = Between 1 and 3; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Between 3 and 5; 5 = A lot of time

ElementDescription: 4) How much of a role do you believe that you will have in your child's treatment?
Notes: 1 = No role; 2 = Between 1 and 3; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Between 3 and 5; 5 = Big role

ElementDescription: 5) I believe that the school will have to be involved in the therapy.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 6) I believe that my child will improve quickly.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 7) I believe that only my child will be seen in treatment.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 8) I believe that it will take a long time for my child to improve.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 9) I believe that all the information that I give out will be confidential.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 10) I believe sessions will be four times a week.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: "11) Once therapy begins, I believe that my child will improve."
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 12) I believe that this treatment sounds reasonable for the problems that I have been experiencing with my child.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 13) I believe this form of treatment will help me better understand my child's problem behaviors.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 14) I believe I will be motivated to work in this type of treatment with a therapist.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 15) I believe this treatment will be valuable in treating my child's problems.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 16) I believe this treatment will improve my child's adjustment at home or at school.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 17) I believe that this treatment will make my child worse.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 18) I believe this treatment will be more helpful than no treatment at all.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 19) To what extent do you believe therapy described will be worthwhile.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: 20) I believe I will have to do a lot of work outside of the sessions in order for my child to improve.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: "21) How will this treatment compare in effectiveness with medical treatment (e.g., medication) for your child?"
Notes: 1 = Much less effective; 2 = Somewhat less effective; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Somewhat more effective; 5 = Much more effective

ElementDescription: 22) How will this treatment compare in effectiveness with your own attempts at dealing with the problem?
Notes: 1 = Much less effective; 2 = Somewhat less effective; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Somewhat more effective; 5 = Much more effective

ElementDescription: I believe it is important for me to participate in treatment each week.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neutral/Don't know; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
